channel.title: index on jas/text
channel.description: Recent content in index on jas/text

item.title: Iamb 1
item.description: Honey in my mind Her sweet words were kind Summer suns setting on our love's begetting The time was too short to learn the ways of her heart but for the Septembers spent with arms bent around her shoulder on splintering bench in trees turning color, cold creeping closer October already over and now you're her lover and you'll love her, 'til November On whim of bless'd sun bring green fields through seasons run

item.title: Free Verse 1
item.description: Forgive the little motions which make subtle ripples rise that coalesce and grow to waves, to tides, to fearsome walls of water It is nothing like that now just a simple sound praying and pleading as though the ocean hears Indifferent though, breaking against deaf ears taking off the solitude of years

item.title: Limerick 1
item.description: It was lovely as love could be Only alone, you with me 'Til one day I saw Into life's gaping maw And ran away across the sea

item.title: In the Beginning*
item.description: *Well not really the beginning This is a post overdue, to a blog I should have started a while ago, if not to achieve anything other than a “I could so I did” thing. After multiple failed attempts using blogger, wordpress, et al. I stopped because I didn’t really like the workflow. 1 So I’m not one to bear the burden of a over-heavy work-flow, if it should take much work to spew my words into the void I likely

item.title: Home
item.description: Hugo.io - Classic For text focused goodness About twenty years ago Jobs and Wozniak, the founders of Apple, came up with the very strange idea of selling information processing machines for use in the home. The business took off, and its founders made a lot of money and received the credit they deserved for being daring visionaries. But around the same time, Bill Gates and Paul Allen came up with an idea even stranger and more fantastical: selling computer operating systems.
